results.title: Animal behaviour
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Stewart Jackel, senior education officer of Zoo Education Services, and Year 12 students from Prahran High School discuss the adaptive nature of animal behaviour and the ways in which animal structures are used to assist survival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Chris O’Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Anima mundi
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Reggio, Lawrence Taub, Bvlgari and World Wildlife Fund
results.brief_description: This world is indeed a living being endowed with soul and intelligence. This quote from Plato’s “Timeus” guides the spirit of this ravishing short film. An original music score by Philip Glass, based on indigenous music from around the globe, is the soundtrack to a compilation of some of the world’s finest film footage of the animal kingdom. From mammals to reptiles, then to the mysterious worlds beneath the ocean, the film is a poetic celebration of the diversity and beauty of animal life. The music, integral to this film without dialogue, combines orchestral instruments with rhythms and sounds from across the globe. From the majesty of a lion’s face, to the intimate wonder of a cell multiplying, this is an excellent teacher of the rich legacy nature has left our planet. A co-production between Italy and the United States, “Anima Mundi” was partly funded by the World Wildlife Fund to celebrate their Biological Diversity Campaign.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Godfrey Reggio, Lawrence Taub, Bvlgari and World Wildlife Fund

results.title: Angst
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Bob Weis, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Chapman and Lester Film Productions, Film Victoria and Generation Films
results.brief_description: Deb Filler, Sandy Gutman aka Austen Tayshus, and Moshe Waldoks are three Australian comedians who all share one thing in common - they are all children of survivors of the Holocaust. This documentary takes us into the lives of these three Jewish comedians who talk about their lives, their family, their Jewish identity and the impact of the Holocaust in their humour, their performances and their relationships. Includes interviews, excerpts from each of their many live performances, archival footage and footage from the Inaugural Australasian Holocaust Descendants Gathering (1993?).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judy Menczel, Bob Weis, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Chapman and Lester Film Productions, Film Victoria and Generation Films

results.title: Angles on an arc
results.brief_description: Gives proof of the theorem which states that the measure of the angle at the centre of a circle subtended by an arc is twice the measure of the angle at the circle subtended by the same arc.
results.description: Gives proof of the theorem which states that the measure of the angle at the centre of a circle subtended by an arc is twice the measure of the angle at the circle subtended by the same arc.

results.title: Angler's island
results.brief_description: Trout fishing in Tasmania. Trout were released into Tasmanian streams a century ago, and anglers fish in many places with historical associations. Trout are caught, stripped and the young raised in hatcheries to re-stock streams. Shannon Rise during the caddis moth season and the lonely lakes in western Tasmania are favourite haunts for anglers.

results.title: Angle Bay
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Aselwood Productions and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: Angle Bay lies on the southern shore of Milford Haven in Pembrokshire. A scenic and historical impression of this ancient land is given, and the film then reverts to the present day, for Angle Bay is now an ocean terminal and Milford Haven a deep-water harbour for oil tankers. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: Angel
results.creator_credit: Dennis K. Smith, Open Channel Productions and Sharyn Prentice
results.brief_description: You may not know the name Deborah Halpern, but you will certainly recognise her ceramic sculpture with its unique tiling located out the front of the National Gallery of Victoria. Hers is the story of a young ceramic sculptor with no formal training whose public profile has proliferated as the result of an unexpected major commission from one of Australia’s most prestigious art galleries. Deborah Haplpern’s art is inspired by Niki de Phalle, the ‘Art Brut’ movement and the ‘Outsider’ artists of Europe who live and work outside the mainstream gallery system. In this documentary Deborah talks intimately about the influence of these artists on her work and life. It outlines the structure of her sculpture, Angel, as well as the artistic and intellectual processes and motivation behind her work. This is a story of achievement. It is a passionate account of a two year project, the journey of a young artist and her triumphant arrival into the public art forum.

results.title: Andy Warhol and His Work
results.brief_description: This film is a fascinating insight into the man and his work as seen through his own eyes and those of his friends. As the sixties progressed Warhol became more and more involved in film making. A number of his films are classic examples of underground movie making and are valid reflections of the more extreme ends of life in late-sixties America.

results.title: Andy and the lion
results.brief_description: Story film for children. Uses the pictures and text of James Daugherty’s fantasy, based on the Androcles legend, to tell about an American boy who becomes a local hero when his kindness to an escaped lion is repaid with the lion’s friendship. No other credits available.
